website_summaries.verdict: Beats its competitors with a unique design that is durable, versatile, practical. The best float available.
pros: Use it in numerous positions, including lounging, straddling, and sitting
Durable materials cradle your body right below the water's surface
cons: Some users find the hammock section rough

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy those spring-type floats but they are kinda pricy. I decided to give this one a shot and I actually really like it. I am a bigger girl and it keeps me afloat very well. It is comfortable for just relaxing. It doesn't have a cup holder but I am ok with that. I also like that i can sit sideways on it and let the floats come under my arms and sit more upright and talk to people. The fabric and inflatable pieces seem to be good, thick quality. Overall, I am very happy with this float.
customer_reviews.author: Pink ToesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best float ever to stay comfortable and wet (warm in the spring/fall and cool in the summer)
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god I love this! I'm not a big pool person, but now we have a pool. I always hated the lounge floats because you either freeze (wet) or roast and burn (dry). This keeps my body underwater, but my head happily and comfortably out of water. It's like a hammock, but your head and tops of your shoulders (you can position yourself up or down) out of water. It was such a comfortable position to casually watch my kids from my corner of the deep end that I realized it's a comfy reading position. So I put my tablet in double ziplock bags and it was indeed perfect. I bought two more because I am NOT sharing!
customer_reviews.author: JimDiamond

customer_reviews.title: Travels well
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these to take on vacation to Mexico. We used them in the pool and ocean. They pack down flat and don't take up a large amount of space. They inflate quickly so we would deflate to take to/from our room if we didn't want the extra bulk. They're comfy sitting in the hammock position. A little awkward sitting like a chair bc one of the inflatables is larger so you're a little lop sided. One could probably use foam pool noodles in the sides if needed or desired. Remember to insert inflatables before inflating!
customer_reviews.author: Meika

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for traveling to warm places!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these floats! They are so convenient for packing in a suitcase for travel. I've taken them to the Caribbean, to the pond, to the shores of Maine and used them in my backyard pool. They are durable, reasonably priced and easy to store. If you are looking for a float that will keep you out of the water while your floating in the water, this isn't it. Your body does get immersed in the water - but I enjoy that. The larger "roll" is for your neck support and the smaller one for your knees. I've purchased a couple for myself and am now buying them for gifts for friends and family. :)
customer_reviews.author: D CHRISTIE

customer_reviews.title: Inflation part is small and pocket is HUGE
customer_reviews.text: The pockets are sewn TWICE the size if the inflatable, which is such a disappointment because I have one from YEARS ago, same maker I happened to find at Marshall's. It fills up the pockets perfectly, but after 6 years the sides are coming apart. So I ordered the blue one and its ridiculous. No way. Tried inflating but the inflatable had room for 2 in one HUGE pocket. Would love to share a picture, but it seems lately no pics are able.to be uploaded in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I ordered two identical water hammocks and received somewhat different ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two identical water hammocks and received somewhat different items. The hammocks were the same but the inflatable tubes were two very different quality gauges. One pair of inflatables were clearly a lesser gauge and I would assess them as flimsy. The other quite durable.One item came in a marked identifiable box, the other in an unmarked box.One came with a pump, the other did not. If not for the flimsy tubes, I would rate this product higher but I am somewhat dismayed there are so many discrepancies.
customer_reviews.author: Miz Dot Matrix

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good design for floating in the pool
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this floater. You can lounge suspended in the pool without getting your hair wet. I also like that it dries quickly and you can roll it up and store it in a closet without taking up too much space. There are 2 reasons I gave this product a 4* review instead of a 5*: 1) the inflation tubes don't hold their inflation as long as I'd like. I have to give them a top-up every time I use it 2) the stitching is not good. It looks like someone sewed this together with their eyes closed.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs J Shearer

customer_reviews.title: Only keeps your head out of the water
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed with this float. I understand that it's a hammock float and is not supposed to keep you out of the water entirely, but this is ridiculous. It basically just kept my head and shoulders out of the water, while the rest of me was very cold under water at a local spring. I tried using it various ways, and none of them worked. I wish I had kept the box to return it. It's absolutely a worthless float, unless you want to be submerged, but then why would you purchase a float anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Lisa CoreyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pools, ponds and traveling
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to pack in a suitcase for vacation. Packed great to and from vacation. Was used by several adults of various sizes. My husband is 6'5 and 300lbs and it held him great:) Would repurchase in the future. Tip: Follow directions for set up (2 different size blow ups and inflate them after inserting in float). I haven't tried but I think the bigger pool noodles could also be used if you weren't traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Meana

customer_reviews.title: Great for a shortie!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this five stars but the air plugs pop out too easily and lose air. It wasn't a major problem, just an annoyance. The pillows have to be filled while inside the compartment which makes it tough to blow while holding open the slit. The sling is well made from a nylon mesh that is very comfortable and appears to be durable. It packs flat and compact to fit in my suitcase and doesn't weigh a ton. It is able to be used as a float or chair with arms or sides. I am 5', 125 lbs and it is perfect for me. Taller and larger people might not like it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline R. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Relax in the water
customer_reviews.text: I have found that the Poolmaster Water Hammock is the best way to relax in the pool. It is made of a simple waterproof mesh that is supported by the air pillows at your head and lower leg. I can sit astride on it or lay down and totally relax. I have enjoyed it for hours at a time, just being lazy and cool. It is very stable when you are laying down and I feel totally comfortable reading a book while in the water. It is well made and, if you put the air pillows into their pockets BEFORE you blow them up, they are a breeze to insert. You'll be enjoying it in the pool in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: cjbdesigns

customer_reviews.title: Best float ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'2", 240lbs, this float is great and can work for smaller or larger people. You can easily sit up and adjust to float around talking and drinking in sitting position, or kick back and lounge and try to stay awake. So comfy. I highly recommend this product. Simple, easy, versatile and comfortable. Well made. Five stars
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Parker

customer_reviews.title: This is what you want!
customer_reviews.text: The person that first came up with this type of float deserves a medal. So comfortable. I used mine all last year. Stored it over the winter. Pulled it out this year and it still had air. I didn't have to do anything but throw it in the pool and get on it. Kids are forbidden to use my water hammock! I'm 5'9" and it fits me perfectly. There are more expensive slings out there, but not necessarily better. Forget that raft, that inner tube and that big floating lounge. This is what adults you want!
customer_reviews.author: West Texas

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to get on and off without making a fool ...
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my 3rd one ( the other 2 are going strong after at least 5 years) . The design lets you lie half in and half out of the water so you don't totally dry off and get too hot. They are easy to get on and off without making a fool of yourself. Super comfortable. Also easy to inflate and deflate. Just ask Tom Brady.
customer_reviews.author: C. W.

customer_reviews.title: The Best !!
customer_reviews.text: Great float.. Have had one for 8 years now and is still going.. It has stood up to chlorine, kids, and sun.. Bought more for some friends..
customer_reviews.author: Ros63

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for adults and kids!
customer_reviews.text: Needed pool floats that do not take up a lot of room. So many are too large to take to the apartment pool. This one is large enough for a grown adult. Not too big for kids. Easy to inflate. Would be easy to travel with. Love these. Bought two and am Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleC

customer_reviews.title: Love these rafts!
customer_reviews.text: When my husband ordered these, I thought I would not like them at all. It turns out, they are super comfortable and relaxing to lay in! We love them and ordersEd two more! Not super easy to set up, but once you figure it out, they’re awesome!
customer_reviews.author: pma24

customer_reviews.title: *Buyer Beware*
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to keep at our family vacation home that has a pool. The first time we used them great. We recently went down for another family trip and not one of these would stay inflated! So incredibly disappointed that I bought FOUR of these and we could only use them once! That is too much money lost for one time usage. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Flores

customer_reviews.title: The netting on this isn't quite as comfortable as the netting on the other
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product at the same time as the Aqua Leisure Monterey Hammock Pool Float. The netting on this isn't quite as comfortable as the netting on the other, and the inflation process was a bit harder, but this holds my weight much easier. Something I didn't expect was that I would fit in this better (the other product is supposed to be larger, but this one is). It is a very solid product--perfect for a big guy like me. I'm glad I got it, but I wish the material was a bit nicer to touch.
customer_reviews.author: R. G. WilsonTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: The best pool floats
customer_reviews.text: I use these to float in my spa. Comfortable & compact. You can use this in a small pool or spa! I have a manual pump & only takes a few min to pump.
customer_reviews.author: Vampymissk

customer_reviews.title: Best for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our trip to the carribbbean. Absolutely love theses. They don’t take up much space. We’ve taken them a few times to the ocean.
customer_reviews.author: Bessie

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This hammock was a great value. Purchased for my wife however when she's not in the pool, the rest of the family fights for it. It is incredibly easy and comfortable to use. Has taken serious abuse from my kids 2, 6, and 10 and it is still as good as the day I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Newman

customer_reviews.title: the floatie was broken
customer_reviews.text: there's two small floating things that need air put into them in order for the chair to work. one of them had a hole, i tried to patch it on my own as I needed it for the 4th of July and did not have time to return/exchange. needles to say I paid money for a floatie that didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Eilbret Mirzapour

customer_reviews.title: REALLY LOVE THESE POOL HAMMOCKS
customer_reviews.text: REALLY LOVE THESE POOL HAMMOCKS. THEY ARE SO COMFORTABLE IN THE POOL AND ROLL UP FOR STORAGE. WOULD EVEN FIT INTO A SUITCASE TO TAKE ON VACATION SINCE THE PILLOWS ARE INFLATABLE. ONLY WISH THE INFLATABLES TUBES WERE SLIGHTLY LARGER IN SIZE. AND OVERPRICED CONSIDERING THEYRE A PIECE OF MESH FABRIC WITH TWO SLOTS ON ENDS TO INSERT INFLATABLE TUBE. I COULD SEW THIS IN A FEW MINUTES IF I HAD THE MESH AND TUBES. BUT THEY DO SERVE THE PURPOSE AND ARE COMFORTABLE. WE HAVE USED THEM ALOT IN OUR POOL
customer_reviews.author: DEBBIE G.

customer_reviews.title: Three summers and going strong
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in July 2012 and have used it for three summers. I don't even let the air out for winter, just stick it in the deck box. It is still my favorite for reclined floating and I find it very comfortable (5'6" and no lightweight!). It has held up great and still looks almost new.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLY COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: This may be the most comfortable thing mankind has ever created! It looks ridiculous, and the "hammock" fabric feels weird when it's dry, but just inflate the two bladders, slip in, and enjoy being both mostly in the lake (or pool) but also fully supported without feeling confined. It's absolutely amazing. The first five minutes changed me from skeptic to shill--I'd do a commercial for them for free! Over 30 bucks is a bit pricy for what arrives in the little box, but it is too wonderful to quibble over a few bucks...
customer_reviews.author: Constitution-Hugger

customer_reviews.title: New favorite floaty!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. If you like that weightless feeling without your arms being uncomfortably stuck on most floaty arms rests then this is your go to. I read a review that said the man sank because it wasn’t sturdy enough for him. So I will mention that I weigh 125 lbs and it’s perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Came on time nice product is a little shorter then I thought it would be however it works very nice much better then the blow ups
customer_reviews.author: Rita Dropski

customer_reviews.title: These things are awsome!!
customer_reviews.text: Every summer we go to the river or lake. We are always looking for a new raft. I bought 2 of these and they definitely were a hit. Typically we use a life jacket to sit in like a diaper and we just float in the coves. This thing worked out perfect and everyone in the group wanted to know where we bought it. Looks like everyone will have one on the next trip.
customer_reviews.author: H. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: This pool float is amazing. After going through countless floats that pop or ...
customer_reviews.text: This pool float is amazing. After going through countless floats that pop or just don't hold up this hammock lounger is a must buy. The material on this float is strong and therefore will not rip or tear. This float is perfect for relaxing in the pool. We like it soo much that my husband is buying his own so we don't have to fight over who is going to use the hammock!
customer_reviews.author: RK-Frank

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE BUT WISH ONE PILLOW WAS JUST A BIT PLUMPER FOR MY HEAD
customer_reviews.text: Seems nice,I just came out of the pool for testing but I am a small female and my head was partially in the water just enough to get my hair wet.Those who color hair know this is best avoided!I seem to be the only one with this complaint though so I guess it's just FYI. COMFORTABLE though
customer_reviews.author: WOODY

customer_reviews.title: Tough to inflate but work well in the pool
customer_reviews.text: It will give you some work to inflate but when you finish they work well in the pool and you get to relax.
customer_reviews.author: Heli

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: This style floaty is perfect! Just inflate head & tail! I now have 2 for my spa to use as a chill spa in summer!
customer_reviews.author: Vampymissk

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Expected
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase, value for money, inflation easy once you figure it out but no written instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Raia

customer_reviews.title: Quality that will last for years
customer_reviews.text: Quality product like the ones I had for 20 plus years. Don't buy others as they use cheap vinyl bladders.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Cool float, but...
customer_reviews.text: Not for those with long legs, or 6 foot plus. It is a nice little seat though. Bugs and debris do get into the netted part where the inflatables sit, so be careful to not leave outdoors (on the ground really)
customer_reviews.author: Boss Lady J

customer_reviews.title: The BEST ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best pool floats EVER!!!! We brought them to the Dominican Republic and they worked GREAT, definitely worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adorable, floatable and easily totable raft.
customer_reviews.text: Bright pink color, sturdy and quality material. I love these for our boat as well as the beach, they fold up nicely and compact to store in your beach bag, or boat storage. Just blow up to float and deflate to store. Your body will mostly be in the water with these, which is great on hot days, but if your looking to get a tan....better try out a different raft.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Not for Floating.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, not the best pool float to be using if you just want to float around. Maybe if you have younger kids who are just going to jump on them, but not for a sophisticated lady such as myself who just wants to float with her daiquiris...
customer_reviews.author: LK Slack

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for tall people
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to get the "pillows" into the spots and I am just too tall for it. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my $$
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I started airing one of the ends up it blew up/popped! Scared the living daylights out of me. I saw all the good reviews on this item and that's why I purchased it. Evidently I received a damaged one...but, it's very difficult to get the bottoms inserted. To me it was cheaply made. I called it a piece of junk and threw it in to my Herbie for trash day. Big waste of $$. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Stormee

customer_reviews.title: This product is supposed to with aone small floatation and ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is supposed to with aone small floatation and one medium floatation just came in with both small but my older kids We’re here and they wanted to use it so unfortunately I wasn’t able to return it because it was defective
customer_reviews.author: mama-coop

customer_reviews.title: Pool Lover's Dream
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect pool lounger! Very comfortable and keeps part of your body in the water to help keep you cool without having to splash water on yourself or get off to cool off. I purchased a pink one for myself and a blue one for my husband, who also loves it. I just hang it on the back of a deck chair to dry and then roll up to store, which takes up very little space. I notified all my pool friends of this handy lounger and they were on their computers ordering also. Will not disappoint you - best pool product I've ever come across.
customer_reviews.author: Pool Lover

customer_reviews.title: NICE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these for visits to the lake. We were bringing much bigger inflatables with us when we went to the lake and that got very old. These are easy to carry and are great in the water. The only drawback is that my husband is 6'4" and it doesn't fit him, so I'll have to alter one of them. They should be offered in at least 2 different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Rocnwan

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Pool lounger, great for taking a nap also !
customer_reviews.text: We love these ! I also bought one for my wife, in pink, since I love to float around in our community pool & relax. I found that I often pass out, so I learnt to put on plenty of sunscreen before !! It's actually also ergonomic, and gives you plenty of opportunity to get tan while doing that. I actually sold at least 2 of these to my friends already !! Another one bought a similar one and paid a little less, on amazon as well, but we compared these and THIS one seems to be of higher quality, while very similar. Highly recommend !! 5 Stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: The Floridian

customer_reviews.title: The inflatable tubes don't blow up all the way so ...
customer_reviews.text: The inflatable tubes don't blow up all the way so you just sink. It might hold a very petite person or child up, but not a grown man. I am shocked at the high reviews. It is dollar store quality. I feel ripped off, but too lazy to do anything about it. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Floating is nice.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves to float around the pool on the hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great floaters and last
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 blue ones forever. Occasionally resewing as they get a lot of wear and tear with my grandkids. Me and my daughters just love floating on them. My oldest daughter was always borrowing for camping trips as they don't take up much space and then they can float in the river or creek. So I bought her one for her birthday and another for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pam L. Roark

customer_reviews.title: fun, your body stays in the water but your ...
customer_reviews.text: These are seriously a must for the lake, pool, river, etc! High quality, fun, your body stays in the water but your head stays above!!! It kind of cradles your body! I bought the XL one for my significant other as he is a bigger guy.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Gross

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good floating hammock at a good price. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Airshow Joe

customer_reviews.title: Problem w/inflatable tubes
customer_reviews.text: We didn't use these until after the return policy, so couldn't return. No instructions, the smaller tubes worthless, difficulty blowing them up, so didn't bother. Didn't use. Save your $$. Better options on Amazon w/pumps.
customer_reviews.author: Kaly

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT LOUNGER!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect pool lounger! So VERY comfortable and relaxing! Keeps you partially submerged or all but your head submerged just by a body movement....when you want to cool off more just sink down and you're mostly submerged. Can also be used as different types of floats by the way you position and bend the item. I bought one for myself because no one else wanted one...until they tried it...I had to order more! A must have for every pool!
customer_reviews.author: PVB

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised! The cushions are a little difficult to get in and inflate, but not too bad. Other than that, I’m 6’3”, and fit on it just fine. My knees hang over the edge, but it’s the perfect balance between half in and out of the water. For the price, definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: buy these
customer_reviews.text: These rock!!!!!! Forget the others that are either hard to get on or hard to stay on and take forever to blow up. If you have seen the movie the matrix, is how i feel when in one of these WATER HAMMOCKS. About 50% + submerged in the water and feels VERY STABLE AND COMFY.
customer_reviews.author: toddzilla

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pool floats
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these pool floats that everyone loves since installing my pool in 2002. I love the product.
customer_reviews.author: soulcritic

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This floating mat sets up very easilly and gives you plenty of "float" time! I set it up over a week ago, and air pillows remain firm, no leakage! Defo eyelet satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy in DC

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the lake my family loved them , easy to pack doesn't take up much room on the boat, very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: joanah green

customer_reviews.title: Can’t wait to use them!
customer_reviews.text: Excited to get the opportunity to use them! I was in Sint Maarten and a group had a couple of these. I was mad at myself for not bring them with!
customer_reviews.author: Happy buyer

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: My item arrived today Damaged!! Air will not stay in tubes!!! Cheaply made and I am Not happy with it!!
customer_reviews.author: Roberta  Busch

customer_reviews.title: Water time fun
customer_reviews.text: This works great! You are able to have your body in the water but your head stays completely above water. It works like a air mattress type float, but in those you stay above water and this allows you to keep your head up while still in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It’s fun and portable- great for pool and beach and easy to clean and dry. The air tubes seem a bit cheap and flimsy but they have lasted so far.
customer_reviews.author: A. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Best pool float around!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pool float if you like to be in the water rather that above it since other than your head and knees, most of you is in the water which we like. Very comfortable and easy to get on/off. Packs up nicely and we have taken these to Arizona and Cabo in our luggage. Very little air required to inflate the head and knee tubes.
customer_reviews.author: SeanFromKent

customer_reviews.title: Easy to transport and store
customer_reviews.text: Best ever float. Can sit or lay on it. Can easily blow up the 2 small pillows. Have used these for years.
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: Not a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Inflatable ends would not hold air for long and it was a beast to get it together. Lasted for about 10 minutes in the pool before it was inevitably useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kerryione

customer_reviews.title: much better than a noodle
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these to use in the pool on a recent trip to Florida. The partial submerge is great for keeping cool in the heat. Very relaxing and supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars if all correct pieces were included
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for Maui trip and don’t blow them up until we arrived. One had the correct inserts to blow up but the other one had two small ones. It made it impossible to lay on it without going under water. Would be happy with the purchase if you would ship me the larger insert for neck. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Phil D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool Float
customer_reviews.text: These pool floats fill easily as well are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Waldman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to repair
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable I like that the tubes are seperate from the mesh
customer_reviews.author: David N Runk

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: I wish both floats were the same size would be it better for sitting on it like a chair Bummed that it only lasted a few uses the headrest deflates it must have a small leak which has gotten worse with each use
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Am really happy with this. I like that you are sort of under the water but not totally. The only drawback is that the two inserts (top and bottom) deflate quite quickly. Otherwise i would highly recommend. It also dries very quickly and is easy/light to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Helena

customer_reviews.title: floats well and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: don't be fooled by unconventional looks. It is comfortable and floats well. The rough texture might be hard on skin in bouncy situation though. Installing the floats in the sleeves a bit tough until you figure out to put them in un-inflated.
customer_reviews.author: paul moll

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pool toy.(Also great at the seaside!) easy to store or carry. Lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pool toy... a dream to store. Bought two years ago in Santa Fe, at Tuesday's Child, and never found them again! Discovered them on Amazon just this summer and bought 4! (If I could have had a franchise I could have sold 100 of these things over the years. We still have the originals!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: The most fun on the water
customer_reviews.text: So very easy to travel with. We took it on a Caribbean cruise and blew it up at the first stop. On each island people stopped and asked us where we got them. Everyone wanted one!!! At the end of the trip we deflated them and put them back into our suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rothman

customer_reviews.title: Well Built Pool Float
customer_reviews.text: The pool float is as advertised. The two inflatable bladders seem heavy duty. The webbing is similar to the material they make lawn chairs from; it seems tough and durable. The bladders are tough to blow up by mouth; a small hand pump made the task much easier. The float easily supports an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Good float for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these just to try out and am happy with the product. Very comfortable and seems to be made well for the inexpensive price. I can lie on my stomach as well which isn't easy to do with other floats. I can see where other reviewers have said the plastic air tubes are not the best quality and will follow their advice of replacing those with a noodle when we need to.
customer_reviews.author: AmyMichelle

customer_reviews.title: Great float that takes up a small amount of space when not in use.
customer_reviews.text: Have used the spring floats that sit up for years and love them but they take up so much room in the boat. This hammock is really comfortable, keeps your midsection lower in the water, dries quickly and rolls up into a small footprint. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Long Time Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Hammock
customer_reviews.text: Great water hammock. My husband absolutely loves this. He can do his exercises (stomach crunches) and relax at the same time. Not easy to find this, but Amazon came through. We got the pink color because it was the cheapest.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Fox

customer_reviews.title: This is hands down one of the most relaxing floats ...
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down one of the most relaxing floats I've ever gotten. I can relax with everything supported and my head up.
customer_reviews.author: Prime junkie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product because it take up less room for storage and is also comfortable for me. To short for my 6'5" husband though.
customer_reviews.author: BeeJay

customer_reviews.title: Going into it's 3rd summer of use!
customer_reviews.text: Love this float... Great to sit in and relax with friends in the pool. Fits me comfy...I'm 5'4" I love it that I can keep my hair dry, but body submerged...looking to buy more since one of my friends will jump in it as soon as I get out! Very sturdy. Zero issues with thing - the kind of purchase I like!
customer_reviews.author: HORSE LOVER

customer_reviews.title: Leak in one of the inflatable pillow!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and anxious to use in my pool however one of the inflatable pillows has a leak so of course it will not hold any air.
customer_reviews.author: Dorrit

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for lounging in the pool. Fall asleep when I am in it. Love actually being in the water vs just floating in something above it.
customer_reviews.author: cidgrafx

customer_reviews.title: Great float.
customer_reviews.text: Great float...I use it more than my Frontgate. Live that you are submerged...youbstay mych warmer when your wet body isn't in the cooler air or breeze but it 90 degree water instead! :) Comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Stylemom

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to inflate
customer_reviews.text: I like that they are compact and don’t take up a lot of storage space. Really easy to inflate and you can deflate them for the end of season. We use them in the lake. I have about 6 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, it is a simple and versatile pool float. Hope it proves to be durable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Smardon

customer_reviews.title: Best pool float we have had
customer_reviews.text: Best pool float we have had, very comfortable and will not tear. Portable and you can use it to float different ways. we ordered two and it is the favorite float in the pool. Just inflate pillows once you put them inside the ends
customer_reviews.author: Sgrady

customer_reviews.title: These are really good. They work well - not a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: These are really good. They work well - not a lot of whistles and bells, but I really liked the first one so I bought three more. You float low in the water so you stay cool with only your head and knee region sticking out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Dano from Houston

customer_reviews.title: ok if you are looking for cheap
customer_reviews.text: after getting this one - I decided to go ahead and splurge on the Kai float like this - wish I hadnt wasted the money on this one to begin with. Cheaply made and not comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great float, but air leaks.
customer_reviews.text: Nice float, however the head rest needs to be refilled with air every so often. The plug is always tightly in place whenever I check it, so it appears that there may just be a very slow leak. Otherwise it is very comfortable and I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Bought two. Very relaxing. Tried some of the cheaper vinyl ones and they ripped after a couple of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Skywalker89

customer_reviews.title: Good concept but would be better with pool noodle type ...
customer_reviews.text: Good concept but would be better with pool noodle type foam instead of inflatable tubes in the ends which need frequent reinflating
customer_reviews.author: ezmobee

customer_reviews.title: Keep away from ants!,,
customer_reviews.text: I really like it but I am afraid of one thing ; Ants love stussthat.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Orris

customer_reviews.title: Best water sitting on thing
customer_reviews.text: Best water sitting on thing I've found. I don't want a chair that lifts me all the way out of the water - this provides just enough support to keep your head out, while most of you is submerged. It feels strong too - it's a separate bladder inside the stronger material, so I'm hoping for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Miles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our trip
customer_reviews.text: We took these floats to Aruba. The very best way to relieve stress is to float in the Caribbean sea. These pack away in a suitcase with ease and take a few breaths to inflate. The only thing that made them better, was the cocktail I lounged on them with.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pool float ever!
customer_reviews.text: This water hammock is perfect if you like to float with your body in the cool water, instead of staying on the surface. You can adjust the amount of air in the supports that go under your neck & knees to achieve the buoyancy and comfort level that you desire.
customer_reviews.author: an interested consumer

customer_reviews.title: easy to insert pillows and inflate
customer_reviews.text: I'm an average size person and you sit fairly low in the water. Otherwise, easy to insert pillows and inflate.
customer_reviews.author: CDM

customer_reviews.title: Easy to inflate and compact for walking to the local pool
customer_reviews.text: Compact and it works. I love this for our community poos.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmers

customer_reviews.title: A great way to almost float
customer_reviews.text: This is a great choice for relaxing in the water. Compared to others we've tried, it's a little less compact so may be a little tougher to haul around. It's also a bit tougher to deflate than some others. But trade that for being easy to set up and for being more durable than most. This one will last a while. For comfort in the water, it's perfect. I'm about 5' 11" and 180 pounds and my head and feet are out of the water. The rest of me is just under where it's nice and cool. Really like this one!
customer_reviews.author: metaagro

customer_reviews.title: Very Relaxing
customer_reviews.text: Was just what I wanted. My husband liked it too, so I ordered a second one. Very relaxing.
customer_reviews.author: paulaj48150

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Fabric is cheap and sticky. The inflatable part doesn't fill the whole length of the head or footrest and does not inflate enough...stays squishy and doesn't get firm. No arm supprt as it appears to have in the picture. Waste of money. I would return if I didn't have to pay for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Arkansas123

product_meta.title: Poolmaster Swimming Pool Water Hammock Lounge, Blue, (Model: 07431)
product_meta.description:
Relax in cooling comfort with the water surrounding while lounging on the Water Hammock. Designed to position you in a semi-submerged position, you'll stay refreshed and cool while floating your cares away. Constructed in all-weather fabric, the Water Hammock is built for season-after-season enjoyment. Just roll it up for easy storage or tote around when needed. Available in Blue, Pink, and Green.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since 1958, Poolmaster has been a leading manufacturer of aftermarket pool and spa products with an unwavering commitment to quality, service and reliability. Poolmaster offers products across six different product lines- Backyard and Decor, Inflatables, Floats, Maintenance, Swim and Dive, and Toys and Games. Poolmaster - We Make Water Fun!
feature_bullets: All-weather premium material for season-after-season lounging
Traditional hammock-style design cradles you slightly below the water's level keeping you cool and comfortable
Durable 12-gauge vinyl inflatable headrest and footrest inserts for maximum comfort
51 3/4" x 26" in size and rolls up for convenient on-the-go needs and packs away easily for storage
Please see our Green & Pink color options to see these Water Hammocks in action!
